results.title: Legendary West
results.creator_credit: A Postweek Production, Stephen Dito and Larry Klein
results.brief_description: The world’s knowledge of American Western history owes more to the American Western than it does to original documents. Shows the origins of the Western in the dime novels and newspaper reports and give a run down of the criteria used in the Western genre. Using archival material and extracts from Western films, a comprehensive study of both the myth and the reality emerges. The following film extracts are used: Bond of Blood; Local Colour; The Virginian; Tumbleweeds; Ride the High Country; Jesse James at bay; Stagecoach; The Big Trail. Narrated by Ben Johnson.

results.title: Legend of the white snake = Bai she zhuan
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Film Studio and Fu Chaowu
results.brief_description: A love story about the tragic romance of an attractive lady, transformed from a thousand year old white snake, and a handsome young scholar. This legend takes place in the beautiful city of Hangzhou at West Lake. From a work by Tien Han and featuring Shanghai’s Second Peking Opera Troupe with the principal roles performed by Li Bingshu, Fang Xiaoya, Lu Boping, Su Shengyi, Chen Baiping. Chinese dialogue and subtitles.

results.title: Legend of the Wanganui River
results.brief_description: A Maori legend tells of the origin of the Wanganui River long ago. This film recounts the story, revealing something of the importance of the river to Maoris in the past, and illustrating its role today. The camera captures the mood of the river as it cascades down from its mountain source, swirls through narrow gorges, passes by dense forests ringing to the cry of birds, and eventually meets the sea near the city of Wanganui.

results.title: Legend of the seven golden vampires
results.creator_credit: Hammer, Shaw Production, Don Houghton, Vee King Shaw and Roy Baker
results.brief_description: Hammer Horror meets martial arts mayhem in “The Legend of the seven golden vampires,” allegedly the first kung-fu horror film co-produced entirely on location in Hong Kong. This action-packed and bloodthirsty tale of vengeance and family honour begins in nineteenth century Transylvania, where Kah, High Priest of the Seven Golden Vampires, abases himself before the mouldering tomb of Dracula, and begs him to resurrect his vampires - sleeping after a brave farmer dares to kill one of them - so that his temple in the remote village of Ping Kwei may become a site of power once again. However, Dracula, being the sinister creature he is, seizes the opportunity to do more than assist… Exactly one hundred years later, Dr. Van Helsing attempts to convince Chinese academics from Chunking University to help him locate the village to uncover the six remaining vampires. After suffering their scorn, he resolves to leave Chunking, only to be confronted by a man claiming to be the ancestor of the farmer who had killed the seventh vampire. Hsi Ching reveals that Van Helsing and his foppish son Leyland have been under the exclusive protection of his family since coming to China, and provides the Professor with proof of his connection to the vampire legend. After the wealthy and adventurous widow Vanessa Buren offers to finance the risky venture, Van Helsing agrees to lead an expedition to Ping Kwei to rid the village of its vampire curse. But the forces of evil are stronger than they anticipate, and it takes all the martial arts skill of Ching’s siblings combined with Van Helsing’s vampire-vanquishing experience to defeat the remaining vampires and legions of undead sent to stop them before it is too late. The vampires in this film are very Westernised and quite different to the more well known “hopping vampires” found in later films such as Encounters of the spooky kind (1980) and Mr. Vampire (1985). Stars Peter Cushing as Van Helsing, Chan Shen as Kah, David Chiang as Hsi Ching, Julie Ege as Vanessa Buren, and Shi Szu as Mei Kwei. In English with some subtitles.

results.title: Legend of the raven
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films, Judith Crawley, Edmund Reid and Peter Cock
results.brief_description: Shows how man passed on his heritage of tradition and justice even before he developed the printed word. An Eskimo grandfather tells an old legend about how the raven was banished from the society of men and birds because he was selfish in time of winter hunger. The story is enacted through the use of authentic Eskimo stone and ivory carvings and enriched by actual chants.

results.title: Legend of the overfiend = Urotsukidoji (D)
results.creator_credit: Toshio Maeda, Japan AV Network, West Cape Corporation, Yasuhito Yamaki and Hideki Takayama
results.brief_description: Based on the legend that the world as we know it is really made up of three worlds: the world of humans; the world of man-Beasts and the world of Monster Demons. Chojin is the superfiend whose destiny it is to unite the three worlds into the Land of Eternity every 3,000 years; a world filled with violence and chaos. Humanity must pit all its forces and wits to prevent this legend from becoming a reality. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS ANIMATED FILM HAS AN ‘R’ RATING FOR PERSONS OVER THE AGE OF 18 DUE TO THE EXPLICIT VIOLENT AND SEXUAL NATURE OF ITS CONTENT.

results.title: Legend of birds
results.brief_description: Native birds of New Zealand and how they figure in Maori legends. How the Maoris caught birds and used their flesh and feathers. Studies of various birds including the owl, robin, tomtit, fantail, bell-bird, tui, wood pigeon, wecker, kiwi, takehai, grey warbler, kaka and kia.

results.title: Legend
results.creator_credit: Legend Productions, Arnon Milchan and Ridley Scott
results.brief_description: Legend is a fairytale produced on a grand scale, set in a timeless world peopled with fairies, elves, goblins, trolls and demons. It is the story of Jack (Tom Cruise), a young heroic peasant who takes his sweetheart, the beautiful princess Lili (Mia Sara), to see the most powerful creatures on earth, the last surviving unicorns. Unknown to the young lovers, Darkness (Satan) played to perfection by Tim Curry is using the innocence of Lili to set a trap to capture and destroy the creatures of light, the golden-horned unicorns. Children of all ages will be entranced by the magnificent make-up effects, from the smallest elves to the giant Darkness. The latter is unquestionably the most impressive depiction of Satan ever brought to the screen. It is a classic story of good and evil, love and hate.

results.title: Legend
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Richard Raxlen
results.brief_description: A beauty-and-the-beast tale, enhanced and embellished by the filmmaker’s art. The screen becomes a luminous, shimmering dance of colors from which the story’s characters emerge like ephemeral beings from a mystic world, before melting away again into the chimerical void from which they came. The story is based on a west-coast Indian legend. The feats that the youth must perform to win his fair maiden are distinctly Indian ones, and masks are used in the telling of the story. Cast includes Stanley Coles, Patrick Cullen, Molly Dressel, Lubba Goy, Michael Hogan, Susan King, Mary Lou de la Salle, Jack Messinger, Sandy Nicholls, Marshall Webster. Photographed by David de Volpi. Edited by Margaret Wescott. Music by Bruce Mackay. Sound by Claude Delorme, Michel Hazel, Les Halman. (Awards: Toronto; New York)

results.title: Legault's place
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and Suzanne Angel
results.brief_description: The story of an old man and his aging cabin in a new neighbourhood of Montreal. At one time the cabin was surrounded by fields but eventually this changed to an attractive city suburb. Legault’s place became an eye- sore. What happens when the old man is persuaded to sell makes a warm and humorous story.
